post_info.post_title: And we are the sexually irresponsible ones?

Jaxian

Local religious leaders are vowing to shut down the 7,300-square-foot Klub Layden, saying it could bring crime into the community.

 
 I don't believe this statement follows rationally.
joebrummer

I don't believe this statement follows rationally.

 What do you mean?
Bassman
I saw the story (surprise, surprise!!) and the residents might have a legitimate argument concerning zoning requirements.
Jaxian

What do you mean?

 
 Well, just that I don't think there is any logic which might suggest that criminals will be more attracted to an area with such a club, nor is there evidence to suggest that the club would turn non-criminals in the area into criminals.
Bell

I don't see what's wrong with this. People are doing what they want to do. They are apparently being discrete about it as it's been open for fourteen months and neighbors didn't know. No one is abusing anyone. They don't even sell alcohol. The people who are going to be dishonest with their spouses are going to do it regardless of if there's an available and convenient location. And swinger's clubs, from what I understand, are mostly couples. 
 
 What's wrong with it?
Captain America banned

What's wrong with it?

 
 Well, for one thing, no one invited me!!! :p
Jaxian

Because it is a place where people go to have sex with people they barely know, such an institution has the potential to spread sexually transmitted diseases, which can be negative.
 
 However, I am of the opinion that adults are responsible enough to make those choices for themselves, and it may even be possible to run such a club with very safe sex.
 
 But even if it were, I would personally not attend such a club.
joebrummer

Because it is a place where people go to have sex with people they barely know, such an institution has the potential to spread sexually transmitted diseases, which can be negative.
 
 However, I am of the opinion that adults are responsible enough to make those choices for themselves, and it may even be possible to run such a club with very safe sex.
 
 But even if it were, I would personally not attend such a club.

 
 
 I just feel there is something either ironic or hypocritical here. Heterosexuals are always claiming gays are more sexual dangerous and irresponsible. This is one of 7 clubs....so obviously heterosexuals are not the little angels they potray themselves to be.
Bell

I just feel there is something either ironic or hypocritical here. Heterosexuals are always claiming gays are more sexual dangerous and irresponsible. This is one of 7 clubs....so obviously heterosexuals are not the little angels they potray themselves to be.

 
 I agree. 
 
 I don't think that these clubs are the only indication of it. 
 
 I often see straights proclaming gays are more sexually irresponsible and immoral, but that's just fear mongering to me. Those that shout loudest are usually trying to hide a little voice somewhere.
joebrummer

I agree. 
 
 I don't think that these clubs are the only indication of it. 
 
 I often see straights proclaming gays are more sexually irresponsible and immoral, but that's just fear mongering to me. Those that shout loudest are usually trying to hide a little voice somewhere.

 
 
 and that is just what I am trying to point out with this story and this thread........
Jaxian

I just feel there is something either ironic or hypocritical here. Heterosexuals are always claiming gays are more sexual dangerous and irresponsible. This is one of 7 clubs....so obviously heterosexuals are not the little angels they potray themselves to be.

 
 I think you are likely correct. Majority groups tend to see behaviors they disapprove of in their own group as the exception. Then, when they see that same behavior in a minority group, they generalize that as common across the minority.
 
 But I think most of us here can agree on that. I don't think that even Jyoshu is still making the claim that straights are more sexually responsible than gays.
sinjin

I just feel there is something either ironic or hypocritical here. Heterosexuals are always claiming gays are more sexual dangerous and irresponsible. This is one of 7 clubs....so obviously heterosexuals are not the little angels they potray themselves to be.

 
 So do you feel swinging is dangerous and irresponsible by definition? 
 
 What percentage of heteros do you think have been in a club where casual and/or anonymous sex is taking place between patrons? What percentage of gay men do you suppose have been in such an establishment?
Captain America banned

But even if it were, I would personally not attend such a club.

 
 You didn't get invited either, huh? emoticon_cry
tonybrown74

I don't see what's wrong with this. People are doing what they want to do. They are apparently being discrete about it as it's been open for fourteen months and neighbors didn't know. No one is abusing anyone. They don't even sell alcohol. The people who are going to be dishonest with their spouses are going to do it regardless of if there's an available and convenient location. And swinger's clubs, from what I understand, are mostly couples. 
 
 What's wrong with it?

 
 
 I agree.
 
 It's not my thing, but as long as no one gets hurt, I don't have a problem with it.
tonybrown74

Not to answer for Joe, but:
 
 
So do you feel swinging is dangerous and irresponsible by definition? 

 
 Not at all.
 
 
 What percentage of heteros do you think have been in a club where casual and/or anonymous sex is taking place between patrons? What percentage of gay men do you suppose have been in such an establishment?

 
 Personally I have no idea. That said, 7 clubs in one state would indicate that swinging is bit more popular than many would believe.
 
 The point that I believe joebrummer brings up, is that for as much as some heterosexuals bring up the 'fact' that gays (men in particular) sleep around and supposedly swap partners and suppoedly cheat on our significant others/spouses, it is rather interesting that none of these critics bring up swingers clubs, which seem to be far more popular than many believe.
unkerpaulie

I just feel there is something either ironic or hypocritical here. Heterosexuals are always claiming gays are more sexual dangerous and irresponsible. This is one of 7 clubs....so obviously heterosexuals are not the little angels they potray themselves to be.

 i think it just goes to show that you cant buy into stereotypes. sexual irresponsibility is a very individual thing. you find both prude gays and straights, as well as extremely promiscuous from both sides.
joebrummer

So do you feel swinging is dangerous and irresponsible by definition? 

 
 Not necessarily, but I personally do not think it is healthy behavior. That is just my opinion.. I am far from a prude but I respect the idea of monogamy more than this. It does put people at a higher risk for HIV and these people are allowed to donate blood.....go figure....double standard?
 

 What percentage of heteros do you think have been in a club where casual and/or anonymous sex is taking place between patrons? What percentage of gay men do you suppose have been in such an establishment?

 
 
 I will leave "making up the numbers" to the right wing.
